name: ta551

procedures: T1027.003::[TA551] has hidden encoded data for malware DLLs in a PNG.
T1027.010::[TA551] has used obfuscated variable names in a JavaScript configuration file.
T1036::[TA551] has masked malware DLLs as dat and jpg files.
T1059.003::[TA551] has used cmd.exe to execute commands.
T1071.001::[TA551] has used HTTP for C2 communications.
T1105::[TA551] has retrieved DLLs and installer binaries for malware execution from C2.
T1132.001::[TA551] has used encoded ASCII text for initial C2 communications.
T1204.002::[TA551] has prompted users to enable macros within spearphishing attachments to install malware.
T1218.005::[TA551] has used mshta.exe to execute malicious payloads.
T1218.010::[TA551] has used regsvr32.exe to load malicious DLLs.
T1218.011::[TA551] has used rundll32.exe to load malicious DLLs.
T1566.001::[TA551] has sent spearphishing attachments with password protected ZIP files.
T1568.002::[TA551] has used a DGA to generate URLs from executed macros.
T1589.002::[TA551] has used spoofed company emails that were acquired from email clients on previously infected hosts to target other individuals.

description: [TA551](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0127) is a financially-motivated threat group that has been active since at least 2018. (Citation: Secureworks GOLD CABIN) The group has primarily targeted English, German, Italian, and Japanese speakers through email-based malware distribution campaigns. (Citation: Unit 42 TA551 Jan 2021)
